detaileddescription.para: PWM pin capture captures pulse width.
PWM pin capture captures both period and pulse width.
PWM pin capture captures a single period/pulse width.
PWM pin capture captures period/pulse width continuously.

briefdescription.para: Provides a type to hold PWM configuration flags.

memberdef.name: pwm_capture_callback_handler_t

briefdescription.para: PWM capture callback handler function signature.

simplesect.para: The callback handler will be called in interrupt context.
embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_PWM_CAPTURE` must be selected to enable PWM capture support.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Captured PWM period width (in clock cycles). HW specific.
Captured PWM pulse width (in clock cycles). HW specific.
Status for the PWM capture (0 if no error, negative errno otherwise. See pwm_pin_capture_cycles() return value descriptions for details).

briefdescription.para: Callback API upon configuring PWM pin capture See pwm_pin_configure_capture() for argument description.
Callback API upon enabling PWM pin capture See pwm_pin_enable_capture() for argument description.
Callback API upon disabling PWM pin capture See pwm_pin_disable_capture() for argument description.
Callback API upon getting cycles per second See pwm_get_cycles_per_sec() for argument description.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t pwm, uint32_t period, uint32_t pulse, pwm_flags_t flags)
memberdef.name: pwm_pin_set_cycles

briefdescription.para: Set the period and pulse width for a single PWM output.

detaileddescription.para: The PWM period and pulse width will synchronously be set to the new values without glitches in the PWM signal, but the call will not block for the change to take effect.

Not all PWM controllers support synchronous, glitch-free updates of the PWM period and pulse width. Depending on the hardware, changing the PWM period and/or pulse width may cause a glitch in the generated PWM signal.
Some multi-channel PWM controllers share the PWM period across all channels. Depending on the hardware, changing the PWM period for one channel may affect the PWM period for the other channels of the same PWM controller.
Passing 0 as pulse will cause the pin to be driven to a constant inactive level. Passing a non-zero pulse equal to period will cause the pin to be driven to a constant active level.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Period (in clock cycle) set to the PWM. HW specific.
Pulse width (in clock cycle) set to the PWM. HW specific.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t pwm, pwm_flags_t flags, pwm_capture_callback_handler_t cb, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: pwm_pin_configure_capture

briefdescription.para: Configure PWM period/pulse width capture for a single PWM input.

detaileddescription.para: After configuring PWM capture using this function, the capture can be enabled/disabled using pwm_pin_enable_capture() and pwm_pin_disable_capture().

simplesect.para: This API function cannot be invoked from user space due to the use of a function callback. In user space, one of the simpler API functions (pwm_pin_capture_cycles(), pwm_pin_capture_usec(), or pwm_pin_capture_nsec()) can be used instead.
embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_PWM_CAPTURE` must be selected for this function to be available.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Application callback handler function to be called upon capture
User data to pass to the application callback handler function
if invalid function parameters were given
if PWM capture is not supported or the given flags are not supported
if IO error occurred while configuring
if PWM capture is already in progress

briefdescription.para: Enable PWM period/pulse width capture for a single PWM input.

detaileddescription.para: The PWM pin must be configured using pwm_pin_configure_capture() prior to calling this function.

simplesect.para: embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_PWM_CAPTURE` must be selected for this function to be available.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
if invalid function parameters were given
if PWM capture is not supported
if IO error occurred while enabling PWM capture
if PWM capture is already in progress

briefdescription.para: Disable PWM period/pulse width capture for a single PWM input.

simplesect.para: embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_PWM_CAPTURE` must be selected for this function to be available.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
if invalid function parameters were given
if PWM capture is not supported
if IO error occurred while disabling PWM capture

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t pwm, pwm_flags_t flags, uint32_t *period, uint32_t *pulse, k_timeout_t timeout)
memberdef.name: pwm_pin_capture_cycles

briefdescription.para: Capture a single PWM period/pulse width in clock cycles for a single PWM input.

detaileddescription.para: This API function wraps calls to pwm_pin_configure_capture(), pwm_pin_enable_capture(), and pwm_pin_disable_capture() and passes the capture result to the caller. The function is blocking until either the PWM capture is completed or a timeout occurs.

simplesect.para: embed:rst:inline :kconfig:option:`CONFIG_PWM_CAPTURE` must be selected for this function to be available.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Pointer to the memory to store the captured PWM period width (in clock cycles). HW specific.
Pointer to the memory to store the captured PWM pulse width (in clock cycles). HW specific.
Waiting period for the capture to complete.

briefdescription.para: Get the clock rate (cycles per second) for a single PWM output.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the device structure for the driver instance.
Pointer to the memory to store clock rate (cycles per sec). HW specific.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t pwm, uint32_t period, uint32_t pulse, pwm_flags_t flags)
